security.no_eval_exec_pickle: Absolutely never — primary vector for code injection and privilege escalation
security.no_auth_bypass: Every request must be authenticated — no dev mode, no anonymous access, no exceptions
security.full_audit_trails: Every action attributable to a specific user — manipulation becomes impossible to hide
security.fair_resource_allocation: Logged, auditable, no favoritism — alerts on unequal distribution patterns
security.staff_protection: Burnout detection, workload visibility, no exploitation

philosophy.local_first: Everything runs locally — zero network requests to external AI APIs
philosophy.privacy_first: Code never leaves the machine — offline-capable
philosophy.epistemic_humility: Inspired by Carl Jung — admitting 'I don't know' is sometimes the smartest answer (MIST state)
philosophy.no_matter_principle: When the environment is noisy, separate signal from noise, compress into structured core, keep moving
philosophy.principled_not_perfect: Document every fix, report actual numbers, never claim something works until it does

working_style.context_management: Aggressive — /clear between tasks, subagents for research, narrow scoping
working_style.debugging: Systematic — read error, identify root cause, write failing test, fix, verify

command_conventions.python_always_via_uv: uv run <command> or uv sync — never bare pip

meeting_context_for_claude.who_you_are_meeting: Irfan Kabir — a principled, deeply curious solo developer building THE GRID
meeting_context_for_claude.what_he_cares_about: Getting things right, not just getting things done. Security is non-negotiable. Privacy is sacred. Every line of code serves a mission.
how_to_work_with_him: Be direct and concise — skip filler
Plan before executing on complex tasks
Always verify work — never say 'this should work' without confirming
Match existing codebase patterns before introducing new ones
Respect the security principles — they exist for deeply personal reasons
He thinks in systems — connect the dots across modules
He values epistemic humility — say 'I don't know' when appropriate
He's inspired by things beyond code — music, space, psychology — and that drives his architecture decisions
what_to_prioritize: Root cause fixes over symptom suppression
first_session_suggestions: Ask him what he's working on right now
Reference THE GRID's 9 cognition patterns if relevant
Acknowledge the depth of the safety architecture
Be ready for cross-project context (GRID ↔ Coinbase ↔ wellness_studio)
Offer to run tests or lint after any changes
